availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Daniel S. Adams (Owen County, Kentucky, physician and politician)

body.p: Owen County, Kentucky, physician and town trustee. Kentucky native. Married to Ann Mary Berryman Adams in Owen County, Kentucky, on November 4, 1840. Father of Thomas B. Adams, Lucy Gayle Adams, Daniel Avery Adams, and Stanley G. Adams. Physician in Owen County in 1850. Physician in Owen County in 1860. Household owned six enslaved persons in Owen County in 1860. Member of the Owenton Board of Trustees in Owen County in 1862.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Owen County, District 1, p. 250A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Owen County, District 2, p. 222.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Owen County, District 2, p. 182 A.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Owen County, Owenton, p. 285A-B.
Twelfth Manuscript Census of the United States (1900), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Owen County, Cleveland, District 0053, p. 17.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Owen County Marriages, Film #00272768, p. 13.
